content.copyright:
All emoji names are official Unicode Character Database or CLDR names. Code points listed are part of the Unicode Standard.

Additional emoji descriptions and definitions are copyright © Emojipedia. Emoji images displayed on Emojipedia are copyright © their respective creators, unless otherwise noted.

Emojipedia® is a member of the Unicode Consortium.

data.title: Smiling Face with Open Mouth
data.description:
A yellow face with smiling eyes and a broad, open smile, showing upper teeth and tongue on some platforms. Often conveys general happiness and good-natured amusement.

Similar to üòÄ Grinning Face but with taller, more excited eyes.

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

components.title: Smiling Face with Open Mouth
components.description:
A yellow face with smiling eyes and a broad, open smile, showing upper teeth and tongue on some platforms. Often conveys general happiness and good-natured amusement.

Similar to üòÄ Grinning Face but with taller, more excited eyes.

goesGreatWith.title: Grinning Face
goesGreatWith.description:
A yellow face with simple, open eyes and a broad, open smile, showing upper teeth and tongue on some platforms. Often conveys general pleasure and good cheer or humor.

Not to be confused with üòÉ Grinning Face With Big Eyes or üòÑ Grinning Face With Smiling Eyes, which have the same smiles but more expressive eye shapes. 

This emoji has a cat variant, üò∫ Grinning Cat Face.

goesGreatWith.title: Smiling Face with Open Mouth and Smiling Eyes
goesGreatWith.description:
A yellow face with smiling eyes and a broad, open smile, showing upper teeth and tongue on some platforms. Often conveys general happiness and good-natured amusement.

Similar to üòÄ Grinning Face and üòÉ Grinning Face With Big Eyes, but with warmer, less excited eyes.

This emoji has a cat variant, üò∏ Grinning Cat Face With Smiling Eyes.

goesGreatWith.title: Grinning Face with Smiling Eyes
goesGreatWith.description:
A yellow face with smiling eyes and full-toothed grin, as if saying Cheese! for the camera. Teeth may be smoothed-over or crosshatched. Often expresses a radiant, gratified happiness. Tone varies, including warm, silly, amused, or proud.

Prior to 2017, Apple's design resembled its üò¨ Grimacing Face.

goesGreatWith.title: Smiling Face with Open Mouth and Tightly-Closed Eyes
goesGreatWith.description:
A yellow face with a broad, open smile and scrunched, X-shaped eyes. Often conveys excitement or hearty laughter.

Similar to üòÄ Grinning Face but with eyes that might say Squee! or Awesome! An emoji form of the >< or xD emoticons.

goesGreatWith.title: Smiling Face with Open Mouth and Cold Sweat
goesGreatWith.description: Has the same grin and eyes as üòÑ Grinning Face With Smiling Eyes but with a single, blue bead of sweat, usually over its left eye. Intended to depict nerves or discomfort but commonly used to express a close call, as if saying Whew! and wiping sweat from the forehead.

goesGreatWith.title: Rolling on the Floor Laughing
goesGreatWith.description:
A yellow face with a big grin and scrunched, X-shaped eyes, tilted on its side as if rolling on the floor laughing (the internet acronym ROFL). Sheds two tears and tilts right on most platforms. Often conveys hysterical laughter more intense than üòÇ Face With Tears of Joy.

Using shown tilted leftwards, though WhatsApp's design tilts to the right.

Microsoft's design previously featured a smiley with hands and feet.

goesGreatWith.title: Slightly Smiling Face
goesGreatWith.description: A yellow face with simple, open eyes and a thin, closed smile. Conveys a wide range of positive, happy, and friendly sentiments. Its tone can also be patronizing, passive-aggressive, or ironic, as if saying This is fine when it’s really not.

goesGreatWith.title: Smiling Face with Smiling Eyes
goesGreatWith.description:
A yellow face with smiling eyes and a broad, closed smile turning up to rosy cheeks. Often expresses genuine happiness and warm, positive feelings.

An emoji form of the ^^ emoticon.

On Snapchat, this emoji next to a contact denotes that you message that person often but they aren't your #1 Best Friend.

goesGreatWith.title: Smiling Face with Halo
goesGreatWith.description:
A yellow face with smiling eyes, closed smile, and halo, usually blue, overhead. Often represents angels, prayers, and blessings. May also convey angelic behavior, e.g., doing good deeds. See also üëº Baby Angel.

Several platforms, including Apple, feature an expression similar to their üòä Smiling Face With Smiling Eyes.

goesGreatWith.title: Smiling Face with Heart-Shaped Eyes
goesGreatWith.description:
A yellow face with an open smile, sometimes showing teeth, and red, cartoon-styled hearts for eyes. Often conveys enthusiastic feelings of love, infatuation, and adoration, e.g., I love/am in love with this person or thing.

This emoji has a cat variant, üòª Smiling Cat Face With Heart-Eyes.

goesGreatWith.title: White Smiling Face
goesGreatWith.description:
A classic smiley. A yellow face with a modest smile, rosy cheeks, and soft, closed eyes. Many platforms, including Apple, feature relaxed eyebrows. Conveys a wide range of warm, positive feelings, including love, happiness, and gratitude.

Similar to üòä Smiling Face With Smiling Eyes, which has a broader smile, no eyebrows, and smiling eyes.

This smiley predates Unicode emoji support. In its Unicode name of White Smiling Face, white does not refer to skin tone or ethnicity. See the glossary for the term white in Unicode character names.

goesGreatWith.title: Smiling Face with Tear
goesGreatWith.description:
A yellow face with open eyes, a thin closed-mouth smile, and a single tear falling from one of its eyes. Can be used to express a wide range of emotions and expressions including gratitude, tender happiness, an attempt to look happy when actually sad, or smiling through pain. Can also be a response to something that is bittersweet.

This emoji and üôÇ Slightly Smiling Face have a similar smile, and üò¢ Crying Face and üòø Crying Cat have a similar lone tear. Not to be confused with üòÇ Face with Tears of Joy, which has a wide toothy grin and tears coming from both eyes.

goesGreatWith.title: Grimacing Face
goesGreatWith.description:
A yellow face with simple open eyes showing clenched teeth. May represent a range of negative or tense emotions, especially nervousness, embarrassment, or awkwardness (e.g., Eek!).

Resembled üòÅ Beaming Face With Smiling Eyes on Apple iOS prior to 2016. Apple’s design for ü•∂ Cold Face features the same mouth. Samsung's design previously featured more puckered-looking lips. 

On Snapchat, this emoji next to a contact denotes that you send the most snaps to the same person that they do., i.e., you share a #1 Best Friend.

goesGreatWith.title: Drooling Face
goesGreatWith.description:
A yellow face, usually shown with closed eyes and raised eyebrows, with saliva drooling from one corner of its mouth. Often used to show desire for a person (sexy, attractive) or object (e.g., delicious food). May also represent someone is tired or sleeping.

Not to be confused with üòã Face Savoring Food or üò™ Sleepy Face.

Samsung's design previously featured a startled facial expression.

goesGreatWith.title: Face with Cowboy Hat
goesGreatWith.description:
Yee-haw! A yellow smiley wearing a wide-brimmed, brown-leather cowboy hat. Its smile varies across platforms. May convey a sense of exuberance, whimsy, confidence, adventure, or other sentiments.

Several vendors, including Apple, feature the same expression as their üòÉ Grinning Face With Big Eyes.

goesGreatWith.title: Smiling Face with Sunglasses
goesGreatWith.description:
A yellow face with a broad, closed smile wearing black sunglasses, as if a pair of classic Wayfarers. Often used to convey the slang sense of cool. May also express a confident, carefree attitude or that something is excellent.

ü§ì Nerd Face wears similarly shaped eyeglasses.

On Snapchat, this emoji next to a contact denotes that you have best friends in common with this person.

goesGreatWith.title: Pile of Poo
goesGreatWith.description:
A swirl of brown poop, shaped like soft-serve ice cream with large, excited eyes and frequently a big, friendly smile.

Widely agreed to have been inspired by the various poop-shaped characters within the Dr. Slump manga series by Akira Toriyama.

May be used to represent feces and other bathroom topics as well as stand in for their many related slang terms. It also enjoys a wide range of idiosyncratic applications, such as conveying a sense of whimsy or silliness, given its fun, happy expression.

Microsoft and Google previously depicted a literal pile of feces, Google’s design featuring stink lines and flies hovering above it.

Available as an Apple Animoji.

This emoji predates the inclusion of emojis within Unicode. It was first added to early Japanese emoji keyboards by Softbank in 1997.

goesGreatWith.title: Smiling Cat Face with Open Mouth
goesGreatWith.description: A cartoon cat variant of üòÄ Grinning Face. Depicted as yellow on major platforms.

goesGreatWith.title: Grinning Cat Face with Smiling Eyes
goesGreatWith.description: A cartoon cat variant of üòÑ Grinning Face With Smiling Eyes. Depicted as yellow on major platforms.

goesGreatWith.title: Person Raising Both Hands in Celebration
goesGreatWith.description:
Two hands raised in the air, celebrating success or another joyous event.

Originally animated to show hands being raised, as might be done along with the the exclamation Banzai! in Japan. Now more commonly only shows the hands in the air.

goesGreatWith.title: Selfie
goesGreatWith.description: A mobile phone held up to take a selfie (photo of the person holding the phone or camera). Generally represented as a disembodied arm holding a mobile phone.

goesGreatWith.title: Orange Book
goesGreatWith.description:
A closed, orange, hardcover book—similar to the Emojipedia logo üìôüòÉ. Commonly used for various content concerning reading, writing, learning, and schooling. May also be used as an orange accent color.

Apple’s cover features the easter egg Vol. 4 by John Appleseed. It was previously purple and the third volume. Samsung’s design previously included the text Orange Book.

titleEmoji.title: Smiling Face with Open Mouth and Smiling Eyes
titleEmoji.description:
A yellow face with smiling eyes and a broad, open smile, showing upper teeth and tongue on some platforms. Often conveys general happiness and good-natured amusement.

Similar to üòÄ Grinning Face and üòÉ Grinning Face With Big Eyes, but with warmer, less excited eyes.

This emoji has a cat variant, üò∏ Grinning Cat Face With Smiling Eyes.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Apple
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Used by Apple devices (iPhone, iPad, Mac) whenever emojis are displayed. Also used by Telegram messenger.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Google Noto Color Emoji
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Default emoji set for Android devices created by Google and used on devices by Google, Xiaomi, Oppo, Huawei, Sony, and many others.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Noto Color Emoji, Animated
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Animated versions of Google’s Noto Color Emoji designs, used by Google Messenger.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Samsung
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Custom emoji set used on Samsung phones and tablets.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Microsoft 3D Fluent
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Glossy, gradient-heavy versions of the Microsoft emoji set. Used within select platforms such as Word and PowerPoint within the Windows 11 23H2 update.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Microsoft Teams (3D Animated)
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: 3D animated versions of Microsoft’s Fluent emoji set, used Microsoft Teams for PC and Android.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Microsoft
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Used across Microsoft PCs. Windows 11 uses the Fluent set. Windows 10’s final update was in May 2019.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: WhatsApp
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Used on WhatsApp for Android and PC. WhatsApp on iOS/MacOS uses Apple designs.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Twitter / X
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Used on Twitter / X for PC. Also used by Discord, Roblox, and Mastodon. Twitter / X on iOS/MacOS uses Apple designs. Android devices use native emoji design as of early 2023.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Facebook
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Used on Facebook for Android and PC. Not used across Meta’s WhatsApp and Instagram platforms. Facebook on iOS/MacOS uses Apple designs.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Huawei
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Custom emoji set used on select Huawei phones and tablets.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: JoyPixels
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: A licensable emoji design set. Previously named EmojiOne.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: LG
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Custom emoji set used on LG devices. Discontinued between 2017 and 2020, replaced by Noto Color Emoji, but then revived in 2021 for LG’s final mobile device.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Telegram
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Animated versions of Apple’s emoji set, custom-built by the Telegram message platform.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Skype
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Animated emoji-adjacent designs used by the Skype platform.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Twitter Emoji Stickers
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Highly-detailed emoji set used by Twitter’s Statuses feature and within the tweet image editor on Android devices.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: SerenityOS
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Custom emoji set used on the open-source SerenityOS.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Toss Face (ÌÜ†Ïä§ÌéòÏù¥Ïä§)
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: A custom emoji design set used by Korean fintech platform Toss.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Sony Playstation
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Used on PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 4 within the device’s messaging functionality.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Noto Emoji Font
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: A minimalist, monochrome version of Google’s Noto Color Emoji designs.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: OpenMoji
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: A open-source emoji design set by the HfG Schwäbisch Gmünd (Design University) in Germany.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Icons8
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: A licensable emoji design set.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: emojidex
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: An open-source emoji design set consisting of user-submitted emoji designs.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Messenger
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Previously used by Facebook’s Messenger platform. Discontinued in 2017, replaced by flagship Facebook emoji set.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: HTC
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Custom emoji set previously used on HTC devices. Discontinued in 2016, replaced by Noto Color Emoji.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: SoftBank
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Japanese mobile phone carrier that created the earliest emoji set currently on record. Discontinued in 2016 following 2014 update, replaced by Noto Color Emoji.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Docomo
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Japanese mobile phone carrier responsible for the most famous early emoji set from 1999. Discontinued in 2013, replaced by Noto Color Emoji.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: au by KDDI
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Japanese mobile manufacturer with its own early emoji designs. Discontinued in 2013, replaced by Noto Color Emoji.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: NEC
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Emoji designs from an early handheld device from 1990.

vendorsAndPlatforms.title: Mozilla
vendorsAndPlatforms.description: Open-source emoji set designs for 2015’s Firefox OS 2.5 update, but never implemented.

data.title: First Look: New Apple Emojis in iOS 18.4 Beta 2
data.excerpt: Today Apple has previewed its latest batch of Unicode emojis as part of the second iOS 18.4 beta.

data.title: Emojis & Dating Apps: Rizz, Romance, Icks & Others
data.excerpt: It‚Äôs no stretch to say that emojis have transformed the way people interact on the internet, and in few other areas is that truer than in the world of online dating.

data.title: Emojis To Tackle The NFL & Super Bowl LIX üèà
data.excerpt: This Sunday is the 59th annual Super Bowl, the biggest night of the American football calendar. This year's championship game is once again a showdown between the Kansas City Chiefs and the Philadelphia Eagles‚Äîso expect to see many football emojis this weekend.
